Articles.Content:
I have recently added real solar system and realism overhaul to my game and I am trying to work out a parachute issue and the one thing I noticed is my kerbals are too large to fit in the display screen and if I switch to internal view it's like I am outside the craft other than that external views look good. I want to troubleshoot the kerbals size and then see if my failing to slow on chute deployment is still happening. Thanks for any help anyone can give.

 

David.

David.

Kerbals look weird with RO sometimes because RO rescales a lot of parts, so Kerbals don’t fit in them properly- in some cases they look tiny because the parts have been made larger, but in others the Kerbals are too big and end up with their heads stuck through the ceiling which can block internal views.

Re. the parachute issue, it sounds like FAR is broken and a game restart should fix it.

Hi,

Thanks for the reply, if by game restart you mean exiting the game and restarting it I have done that plenty of times I real check the FAR install and see if I am missing something if anyone knows anything specific I should look for in FAR that would help.

Thanks.

David

So there appears to be a problem with the Apollo Chute I used a Real Chute and it deployed and slowed me down with no problem.

Thanks for trying to help.

 

David
